creator: moloney.paul.irl@gmail.com
text:
many of the components in connectors project do not report file/dll version
information on windows32 as normally pulled from a resource file e.g.
jk/native/mod_jk, ajp/proxy, ajp/ajplib jk/native/jk_nt_service and

but jk/native/iis and jni/native/libtcnative do.

Also could the version of java and httpd compiled / running against should be
output as is similarily done for mod_ssl and httpd / openssl? 

Can build instructions for windows hosts be supplied in terms of required tools/
apr versions and folder structure be documented?

At the moment I'm having to amend each dsp file to include a dependency on a .rc
file which has to be autogenerated by using the win32ver.awk file from main
httpd which is hackish at best.

unfortunately my employer won't let me contribute code.

creator: moloney.paul.irl@gmail.com
text: Re assigning to tomcat 6 / native jk

creator: timw@ihug.co.nz
text:
Created attachment 21445
Resource file for Apache 2.x mod_jk

Here's a resource file for Apache 2.x
(I'd update the .dsp, but I can't find a version of Visual Studio that old).

Version resource for mod_jk.so on Windows has been committed.
This will be picked up in the Makefile build, but not the .dsp build (since I'm unable to test those).
creator: timw@apache.org
knst.kolinko@gmail.com
text: *** Bug 49201 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Sensible suggestion!  (Commenting to put it on my free-cycles radar).
creator: wrowe@apache.org
wrowe@apache.org
text:
jk_nt_service and apache1.3 are legacy, wouldn't worry about those.

I've worked out a trivial scheme change to jk_version.h and jk.rc, and ensured
the .dsp files and Makefile will both build these correctly.

Will review again the other libs when I have a few cycles, if nobody beats me
to it following the same pattern.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
Most of the libraries referenced in the original report have been removed from the svn repo.

I've checked the remaining libraries and they all include version info once built.
